python-jws is no longer maintained.
Use jwcrypto maybe.

items.title: PID check failed. RNG must be re-initialized after fork(). Hint: Try Random.atfork()
items.body:
It seems I have an issue with multithreading opportunity.
Hasn't the same emerged to any of you?

**Preinfo** 
Python 2.7.3
/etc/debian_version ==> 7.11
uwsgi --version ==> 1.2.3-debian
pip freeze: python-jwt==2.0.1
pip freeze: cryptography==1.7.1



**Debug**
```bash
$ uwsgi --http-socket 127.0.0.1:6000 --plugin python --callable app --module firebase --enable-threads --master --processes 8 --vacuum --uid www-data --gid www-data --chdir /privacy/ --max-requests 100 --harakiri 300 --post-buffering 8192 firebase.py
	INFO 2016-12-23 20:02:38,844 firebase 27535 140618739799904 {'action': 'genToken'}
	Firebase login error: PID check failed. RNG must be re-initialized after fork(). Hint: Try Random.atfork()
	ERROR 2016-12-23 20:02:38,849 firebase 27535 140618739799904 {'action': 'login', 'error': 'PID check failed. RNG must be
	 re-initialized after fork(). Hint: Try Random.atfork()', 'desc': 'firebase token gen error. '}
	Traceback (most recent call last):
	  File "./firebase.py", line 83, in genToken
	    datetime.timedelta(seconds=3600))
	  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/python_jwt/__init__.py", line 98, in generate_jwt
	    '' if header['alg'] == 'none' else jws.sign(header, claims, priv_key).decode('utf-8')
	  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/jws/__init__.py", line 29, in sign
	    signature = signer(_signing_input(head, payload, is_json), key)
	  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/jws/algos.py", line 74, in sign
	    return self.padder.new(key).sign(self.hashm)             # pycrypto 2.5
	  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/Crypto/Signature/PKCS1_v1_5.py", line 112, in sign
	    m = self._key.decrypt(em)
	  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/Crypto/PublicKey/RSA.py", line 174, in decrypt
	    return pubkey.pubkey.decrypt(self, ciphertext)
	  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/Crypto/PublicKey/pubkey.py", line 93, in decrypt
	    plaintext=self._decrypt(ciphertext)
	  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/Crypto/PublicKey/RSA.py", line 235, in _decrypt
	    r = getRandomRange(1, self.key.n-1, randfunc=self._randfunc)
	  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/Crypto/Util/number.py", line 123, in getRandomRange
	    value = getRandomInteger(bits, randfunc)
	  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/Crypto/Util/number.py", line 104, in getRandomInteger
	    S = randfunc(N>>3)
	  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/Crypto/Random/_UserFriendlyRNG.py", line 202, in read
	    return self._singleton.read(bytes)
	  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/Crypto/Random/_UserFriendlyRNG.py", line 178, in read
	    return _UserFriendlyRNG.read(self, bytes)
	  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/Crypto/Random/_UserFriendlyRNG.py", line 137, in read
	    self._check_pid()
	  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/Crypto/Random/_UserFriendlyRNG.py", line 153, in _check_pid
	    raise AssertionError("PID check failed. RNG must be re-initialized after fork(). Hint: Try Random.atfork()")
	AssertionError: PID check failed. RNG must be re-initialized after fork(). Hint: Try Random.atfork()


$ uwsgi --http-socket 127.0.0.1:6000 --plugin python --callable app --module firebase firebase.py

	no errors. it runs ok.

$ uwsgi --http-socket 127.0.0.1:6000 --plugin python --callable app --module firebase --enable-threads firebase.py

	no errors. it runs ok.

$ uwsgi --http-socket 127.0.0.1:6000 --plugin python --callable app --module firebase --master firebase.py

	exception fired.

$ uwsgi --http-socket 127.0.0.1:6000 --plugin python --callable app --module firebase --processes 8 --uid www-data --gid www-data --harakiri 300 --max-requests 100 --enable-threads --stats 127.0.0.1:3005 --chdir /privacy/ --vacuum --chmod-socket 666 --post-buffering 8192 firebase.py

	exception fired.
```



**Basically this is the generator:**

```python
...
import python_jwt as jwt
import Crypto.PublicKey.RSA as RSA
...
__FIREBASE_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL = "my project ... @ google service account stuff.com"
__FIREBASE_PRIVATE_KEY = RSA.importKey("-----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY-----\n..... the secret")

def genToken(userid, username):
    l.info({'action': 'genToken'})
    authKey = ''
    try:
        authKey = jwt.generate_jwt({'iss': __FIREBASE_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL,
                       'sub': __FIREBASE_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL,
                       'aud': "https://identitytoolkit.googleapis.com/google.identity.identitytoolkit.v1.IdentityToolkit",
                       'uid': userid,
                       'claims': {
                                  'premium_account': False,
                                  'NAME': username
                                  }
                       },
                      __FIREBASE_PRIVATE_KEY,
                      'RS256',
                      datetime.timedelta(seconds=3600))
    except Exception as e:
        print("Firebase login error: %s" % e)
        l.exception({"action": "login", "desc": "firebase token gen error.", "error": "%s" % e.message})

    return authKey
```

This causes the `import jwt` to clash. How can I solve this?

items.title: Wrong path when not using a virtualenv
items.body:
If I install this package without a virtualenv, my package is in /usr/local/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages (there is local twice in the path).

It happened with jwt==0.3.2, python-jwt==0.3.3 and python-jwt==1.0.0

items.title: Install with pip
items.body:
Hi,
although I have tried many times the process of installing this package with pip on Linux, it does not work. It always ends with a broken installation and setting up files on ''/usr/local/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/'.
Here is the verbose output of the pip command(pip -vvv install python_jwt)

```
Downloading python_jwt-1.0.0.tar.gz (447kB):
  Downloading from URL https://pypi.python.org/packages/source/p/python_jwt/python_jwt-1.0.0.tar.gz#md5=12a7f8b44a7345f7db6abb348f7d348a (from https://pypi.python.org/simple/python-jwt/)
...Downloading python_jwt-1.0.0.tar.gz (447kB): 447kB downloaded
  Running setup.py (path:/tmp/pip_build_root/python-jwt/setup.py) egg_info for package python-jwt
    /usr/lib/python2.7/distutils/dist.py:267: UserWarning: Unknown distribution option: 'summary'
      warnings.warn(msg)
    /usr/lib/python2.7/distutils/dist.py:267: UserWarning: Unknown distribution option: 'home_page'
      warnings.warn(msg)
    running egg_info
    running build
    running config
  Source in /tmp/pip_build_root/python-jwt has version 1.0.0, which satisfies requirement python-jwt
Requirement already satisfied (use --upgrade to upgrade): jws>=0.1.2 in /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages (from python-jwt)
Installing collected packages: python-jwt
  Running setup.py install for python-jwt
    Running command /usr/bin/python -c "import setuptools, tokenize;__file__='/tmp/pip_build_root/python-jwt/setup.py';exec(compile(getattr(tokenize, 'open', open)(__file__).read().replace('\r\n', '\n'), __file__, 'exec'))" install --record /tmp/pip-OC2che-record/install-record.txt --single-version-externally-managed --compile
    /usr/lib/python2.7/distutils/dist.py:267: UserWarning: Unknown distribution option: 'summary'
      warnings.warn(msg)
    /usr/lib/python2.7/distutils/dist.py:267: UserWarning: Unknown distribution option: 'home_page'
      warnings.warn(msg)
    running install
    /tmp/pip_build_root/python-jwt/dist/.bentomaker.py-0.1-07628d92704c3a8f4413b0c74c228d35/bento/distutils/commands/install.py:59: UserWarning: --compile option is ignored.
      warnings.warn("--compile option is ignored.")
    running build
    running config
Successfully installed python-jwt
```

Here is the destination directory after the install:

```
/usr/local/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/python_jwt-1.0.0-py2.7.egg-info
```

Thanks

items.title: JTI value is freaking huge
items.body:
Hi, thanks for this library, it's just what I needed :)

The only problem I have is that the JWTs it is producing are very large.  I had a look and found a JTI field which was around 200 bytes, due to:

claims['jti'] = urlsafe_b64encode(urandom(128)) 

Which is a 1024-bit value.  I think that using 16 bytes (128 bits) would probably make more sense here as a still very conservative default.

Reasoning: 128 bits is a "sufficiently random" message ID for almost any purpose.It has a birthday bound of around 10^15 messages (e.g. 1 peta-message) with a collision probability of 1 in 10^9.

Or put another way, if you're processing 1 million messages per second and their validity period is 1 year, there will be less than 1 in 1 trillion probability that you'll see the same message-id twice, if they're 128 bit values.

See: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Birthday_attack for more details.

Thanks! - Blair.

items.title: How can i intentionally expire the generated token which has expiration time of future date.
items.body:
Hi, 

I am in situation where i want to expire the already generated token which has expiration time of future date.

This how i am generating the token with 30 days expiration time.

```
def get_jwt_token(**data):
    key = RSA.generate(2048)
    token = jwt.generate_jwt(data, key, 'PS256', datetime.timedelta(days=30))
    return token
```

And here i am verifying the generated token.

```
def verify_jwt_token(token):
     return jwt.verify_jwt(str(token)) #This returns claim which i used further.
```

Thanks,
AbdulWahid

items.title: Unable to install released version
items.body:
When trying to install last release, it fails:

Downloading/unpacking python-jwt
  Downloading python_jwt-0.2.0.tar.gz (445kB): 445kB downloaded
  Running setup.py egg_info for package python-jwt
Downloading/unpacking jws-pss==0.1.0 (from python-jwt)
  HTTP error 404 while getting http://github.com/davedoesdev/python-jws/tarball/master#egg=jws-pss-0.1.0
  Could not install requirement jws-pss==0.1.0 (from python-jwt) because of error HTTP Error 404: Not Found
Cleaning up...
Could not install requirement jws-pss==0.1.0 (from python-jwt) because of HTTP error HTTP Error 404: Not Found for URL http://github.com/davedoesdev/python-jws/tarball/master#egg=jws-pss-0.1.0

It seems that either the bundled python-jws is no longer needed but still referenced in the setup.py, or the tarball was accidentally deleted..

Can you help ?
